title: The best and worst NFL offseasons in hindsight: Barnwell stacks all 32 teams into seven tiers
content: The Colts' deal for Daniel Jones looks great now; the Texans' OL deals do not. Let's review every team's signings, trades, hirings and draft picks with hindsight.

title: Billups, Rozier arrested in gambling investigations
content: Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups and Heat guard Terry Rozier have been arrested as part of a pair of investigations related to illegal sports betting and rigged poker games backed by the Mafia, authorities announced.

title: Messi, Inter Miami sign extension through 2028
content: Lionel Messi has signed a contract extension to extend his stay at Inter Miami, it has been announced.

title: No. 1 pick Flagg assesses Mavs debut: 'Not great'
content: Cooper Flagg became the fifth Dallas player to record a double-double in his NBA debut, but the results for him and the Mavericks against the Spurs on Wednesday night did not measure up to the anticipation.

title: Marathon record holder gets 3-year doping ban
content: Women's marathon world record-holder Ruth Chepng'etich has been banned for three years after admitting to a doping violation.

title: Wembanyama wows with 40-point performance
content: Victor Wembanyama paced the Spurs to a runaway win over the Mavericks, his 40 points the most for a player in a season opener in San Antonio franchise history.

title: Edgecombe's 34 most in debut since Wilt in '59
content: Sixers rookie VJ Edgecombe lit up the Celtics with 34 points on Wednesday night, the most in an NBA debut since Wilt Chamberlain had 43 in 1959, as the Sixers won 117-116.

title: Middleton: Reception in Milwaukee 'meant world'
content: After 12 seasons and 735 games with the Bucks -- highlighted by winning the 2021 NBA championship -- Khris Middleton played his first game as a visitor in Milwaukee on Wednesday night, this time as a member of the Wizards.

title: Payton: No intent to offend Wilson with comment
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said he didn't mean to criticize Russell Wilson by saying he had told Giants officials that he had hoped to face him instead of Jaxson Dart

title: üèà Bolts TE Gadsden benched by father in fantasy
content: Oronde Gadsden II will be starting in many fantasy football lineups this week -- but not in his own father's.

content: We have just over a month until Selection Day and these battles for CFP slots and major awards should be fun.

content: Jefferson, Ja'Marr Chase and CeeDee Lamb produce huge numbers, but is there any chance they can catch Rice?

title: 'J Herbo' has turned on the turbo: Herbert is having a career-best rushing season
content: Quarterback Justin Herbert looks to continue to step up for the Chargers as a runner against the Vikings.

content: Our college football experts provide insight on conference title contenders and key matchups ahead of Week 9.

content: From seniors who have taken the national stage before to freshmen entering the spotlight, here is our 1-100.

content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: With Al Horford's arrival, the Warriors enter Steph Curry's final chapter
content: The Warriors have surrounded Curry with one of the oldest rosters in the NBA in search of another title.

title: Arsenal, PSG show why they are the favorites: Making sense of Champions League Matchday 3
content: Champions League MD3 was about the goals, and lots of them: 71 across 18 games, to be precise, with some statement wins for tournament favorites (Arsenal, PSG) and big clubs that needed a lift (Liverpool). Let's break it down.

title: Tullis-Joyce's rise to USWNT, Man United No. 1 ... via a rainforest
content: USWNT and Manchester United goalkeeper Phallon Tullis-Joyce spent her offseason in the Amazon and has remained patient for her moment in the spotlight.

title: Dest's starting spot with the USMNT doesn't look as secure as it once did
content: There's no denying Sergi√±o Dest's talent, but amid defensive shortcomings and disciplinary issues, he might no longer be a lock to start at right back.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: Highlighting players such as Swift, who are enjoying a good run in fantasy recently, and why it will continue.

content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 8, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

content: Heavyweight Joseph Parker defends his interim title Saturday, but what other big fights can the division make in 2026?

content: The top 25 transfers, ranked by impact this season -- beginning with South Carolina's Ta'Niya Latson.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Why Cl√°sico could hinge on battle between Madrid's Bellingham and Bar√ßa's Pedri
content: Jude Bellingham and Pedri both dreamed as kids of being Cl√°sico heroes. Whichever one outplays the other on Sunday will drive their team to victory.

title: Cl√°sico injury update: Will Huijsen, Raphinha return for Real Madrid-Barcelona?
content: Real Madrid host Barca in the first Cl√°sico of the season on Sunday. Both teams have plenty of injury concerns.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to loan Barcelona goalkeeper Ter Stegen?
content: Chelsea are continuing to explore the market for a goalkeeper, with Barcelona's Marc-Andr√© ter Stegen a potential option on loan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Championship picture, schedule, stats and facts
content: Formula 1 ventures to Mexico City for round 20 of the 2025 season. Find out how the championship shapes up and everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Leaving IndyCar for F2 sets Colton Herta up for F1 -- if he ever gets the call
content: American Colton Herta is leaving IndyCar to join Formula 2, so if the Cadillac test driver ever gets his shot in F1, he can hit the ground running.

title: No oil from Russia soon? Trump sanctions to hit India‚Äôs crude imports
content: New US sanctions on major Russian oil firms Rosneft and Lukoil are likely to lead India to halt crude oil procurement from Russia, which constituted over 36% of its imports this year. Indian refiners are reviewing documentation to ensure compliance, with upcoming orders expected to shift to alternative sources.

title: 'Unfriendly act': Putin says Trump's sanctions 'serious'; asserts won't impact 'significantly'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin acknowledged new US sanctions on the energy sector are serious and will have consequences, but insisted they won't significantly damage the economy. The "unfriendly act" targets Rosneft and Lukoil, aiming to pressure Moscow over the Ukraine conflict. Washington hopes the measures will encourage dialogue, while the Kremlin expresses concern over escalating pressure.

title: Bihar: Mukesh Sahani emerges as MGB's wildcard; is Congress the weakest link?
content: Tejashwi Yadav has been named the Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial candidate for Bihar, with Mukesh Sahani as his deputy. This move signals a shift in the alliance's caste dynamics and leadership. However, the Congress faces internal dissent over ticket distribution, raising concerns about its influence within the opposition bloc.

title: Google hits new milestone: CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; Elon Musk responds
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Yadavs, Muslims & Bhumihars: How parties are solving Bihar's caste equations - candidate lists decoded
content: Bihar's assembly elections are dominated by caste politics, with parties meticulously crafting manifestos and candidate lists to appeal to traditional voter bases. Despite a recent caste survey highlighting the dominance of backward classes, candidate selections appear to prioritize established loyalties and strategic regional combinations over population-based representation.

title: 100 hospitalised in MP on Diwali: Carbide guns cause eye injuries; most victims children
content: Diwali celebrations turned dangerous in Bhopal and Vidisha as over 100 people, mostly children, were hospitalized due to calcium carbide guns.  These makeshift weapons caused serious eye injuries, with some requiring surgery. Authorities have seized hundreds of guns and detained individuals, despite a prior ban. Families are demanding stricter action against sellers.

title: Surprise pickup! Team IND stars take cab; driver left speechless - watch
content: An Uber driver was left stunned after picking up Indian cricketers Dhruv Jurel, Prasidh Krishna, and Yashasvi Jaiswal for a ride. A viral video captured the driver's disbelief as the players entered his vehicle. The clip, shared widely on social media, amused fans who commented on the driver's speechless reaction to the unexpected celebrity encounter.

title: Advice for CEOs: Perplexity CEO on leaderships skills; make peace with some problems
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas revealed the crucial leadership skill: accepting imperfections and focusing on the single most important problem. He advocates for launching products at 80% completion, allowing for rapid iteration and market dominance. This strategy enables companies to adapt and grow in the dynamic AI sector by continuously improving.

title: NC, BJP spar during obituary for Satya Pal Malik; clash over Article 370 role
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Assembly's autumn session began with heated debates over former governor Satya Pal Malik's role in the 2019 Article 370 abrogation during obituary references. NC MLA Bashir Veeri called Malik 'controversial,' sparking a demand for expungement from the BJP, which the Speaker refused. The session concluded with a two-minute silence for the deceased.

title: Terry Rozier net worth: Heat star‚Äôs fortune under spotlight amid scandal
content: Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier and former NBA player Chauncey Billups were arrested Thursday in connection with a federal sports betting investigation. Rozier's attorney stated he is not a gambler and looks forward to clearing his name, asserting prosecutors are relying on unreliable sources. The NBA had previously cleared Rozier of any rule violations.

title: GM CEO doubles down: No CarPlay on any car; claims Steve Jobs' vision
content: General Motors is phasing out Apple CarPlay and Android Auto from all its future vehicles, including gasoline models, not just electric ones. CEO Mary Barra confirmed this company-wide strategy, aiming for a more integrated, proprietary infotainment system. This move prioritises data control and potential subscription revenue over customer preference for smartphone projection.

title: 'Trump shouldn't tell what India will do': Tharoor slams US President
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has rebuked Donald Trump for announcing India's decisions on Russian oil imports. Tharoor emphasized that India will make its own announcements regarding its energy policy, asserting that New Delhi does not dictate US actions. Trump had claimed India would significantly cut Russian oil purchases by year-end, citing assurances from PM Modi.

title: R Ashwin‚Äôs post sets social media on fire! What does it mean?
content: Ravichandran Ashwin's cryptic social media post featuring Nike's 'Just Leave It' tagline has ignited fan speculation.  Three years after his iconic 'leave' against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, the post is seen by many as a clever nod to that dramatic moment. Others interpret it as a subtle critique of Team India's recent struggles and senior players' performances.

title: JJ McCarthy injury update: Vikings rookie QB ruled out vs Chargers tonight
content: Minnesota Vikings rookie quarterback J.J. McCarthy will not play tonight against the Los Angeles Chargers.  He is still recovering from an ankle sprain.  Veteran Carson Wentz will start for the Vikings.  McCarthy is expected to be the emergency third quarterback.  This decision prioritizes his long-term health.  Fans will have to wait longer to see McCarthy in action.

title: 'Stranger Things Season 5' finale release date: Runtime, when and where to watch the series
content: Get ready for the 'Stranger Things Season 5' finale, potentially hitting AMC theaters and other chains alongside its OTT release. Reports suggest a nearly two-hour runtime, offering a cinematic conclusion to the beloved series. While Netflix hasn't officially confirmed, discussions between industry leaders hint at a big-screen send-off. Expect the trailer soon!

title: 'Act of war': How Russia reacted to Trump's sanction fury
content: Russia has reacted furiously to new US sanctions targeting its oil sector, with former President Dmitry Medvedev labeling the move "an act of war." The sanctions, aimed at crippling funding for the Ukraine invasion, coincide with renewed Russian attacks and a collapse in planned diplomatic talks.

title: Historic defeat! India fall at Adelaide for first time in 17 years; AUS win series
content: Australia clinched the ODI series 2-0 against India. The hosts' bowlers made early inroads, but Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer built a strong partnership. A late surge from Harshit Rana and Arshdeep Singh helped India post 264. Australia's chase saw steady contributions, with Cooper Connolly playing a key role to seal the victory.

title: Denver Nuggets vs Warriors injury update: Who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out for today's game
content: The Denver Nuggets, fully healthy with their star trio, face the Golden State Warriors in a highly anticipated October 23, 2025, matchup. While the Warriors will be without Moses Moody and De'Anthony Melton, Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler are expected to lead the charge. Denver's depth and clean injury report give them a slight edge against the favored Warriors.

title: Smriti Mandhana shocked, makes U-turn after LBW scare; NZ players in disbelief
content: Smriti Mandhana's spectacular 109 powered Team India to a commanding position in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025. Surviving a tense lbw review, she went on to register her 14th ODI century, forming a record-breaking 212-run opening partnership with Pratika Rawal. Mandhana continues to dominate as the tournament's leading scorer.

title: Trump eases H-1B visa fee, but student caps cloud the future of Indian talent: Here's why
content: The Trump administration‚Äôs decision to ease the $100,000 H-1B visa fee brings relief to thousands of Indian professionals and students already in the US. However, a new cap limiting foreign students to 15% of total university admissions, with no more than 5% from any one country, casts uncertainty over future Indian enrolments and America‚Äôs talent inflow.

title: 'Had no choice': How a job agent duped Hyd man into joining Russian army; family fears for life
content: A Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, has reportedly signed a one-year contract with the Russian army.  Trapped near the Ukrainian border, Ahmed expressed fear and a lack of choice, pleading for rescue. His family has appealed to the Indian government for his safe return.

title: Terry Rozier arrested in FBI sports betting probe; NBA rocked by scandal
content: Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier was arrested Thursday morning in Orlando as part of a federal investigation into illegal sports betting. The probe is reportedly linked to a 2023 game where unusual betting patterns emerged after Rozier's early exit. This development follows the Jontay Porter scandal and raises further concerns about NBA integrity.

title: 'Illegal immigrant': Indian-origin man arrested after major truck crash kills 3 ‚Äî watch
content: A 21-year-old Indian national, Jashanpreet Singh, faces charges after allegedly causing a fatal crash on Interstate 10 while driving an 18-wheeler under the influence. The incident, which claimed three lives and injured others, highlights concerns over commercial driver licensing for non-citizens. Singh had reportedly entered the US illegally in 2022.

title: Bihar polls: Prashant Kishor targets Tejashwi, takes 'jungle raj' jibe as MGB announces CM face
content: Prashant Kishor, leading the Jan Suraaj Party, critically commented on the Mahagathbandhan's decision to name Tejashwi Yadav as their chief ministerial candidate for the 2025 Bihar elections. He suggested this outcome was predictable given the alliance's history. The opposition bloc formally announced Yadav's candidature, aiming to unite against the NDA.

title: Child can cancel property deals by parents at 18: SC says no formal lawsuit needed
content: Minors can now challenge property sales by parents or guardians after turning 18 without a formal lawsuit. The Supreme Court ruled adults can repudiate such transfers through clear actions, like reselling the property. This decision clarifies that a suit isn't always necessary, especially if the minor remains unaware or in possession.

title: Who is Mukesh Sahani? Mahagathbandhan's deputy CM face; worked with SRK in 'Devdas'
content: The Mahagathbandhan has officially declared RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav as its chief ministerial candidate for the 2025 Bihar elections. Vikassheel Insaan Party chief Mukesh Sahani, known as the ‚ÄúSon of Mallah‚Äù, will be the deputy CM face. Sahani's journey from a small village to the film industry and his political alliance with the Grand Alliance are highlighted.

title: 'More of a boutique hotel': TV, fully-equipped toilet and more; photos show swish jail awaiting Choksi
content: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi, wanted for Rs 13,000 crore bank fraud, is set for extradition to India and will be housed in a specially equipped cell at Arthur Road jail.  Indian authorities presented evidence to a Belgian court showcasing the cell's comfort and security, adhering to European standards.

title: Trapped at the desk: Why 23% of US workers skip vacation despite paid leave
content: Despite widespread access to paid vacation, nearly a quarter of US workers did not take a single day off last year, FlexJobs reports. Heavy workloads, fear of falling behind, and insufficient PTO leave employees trapped in a cycle of constant work. Experts warn that cultural and structural reforms are essential to make rest a viable, sustainable priority.

title: Riley Gaines calls out media bias over Kyrie Irving, seeks Djokovic apology
content: Stephen A. Smith's shift in stance on Kyrie Irving's vaccine choice has drawn a reaction from Riley Gaines. Gaines pointed out that while Smith now supports Irving's personal decision, similar respect hasn't been extended to athletes like Novak Djokovic and Aaron Rodgers, who also faced criticism for their unvaccinated status.

title: WPL: Auction likely in Delhi on Nov 26-27; IPL auction in mid-Dec
content: The Women's Premier League (WPL) auction is scheduled for late November in New Delhi, marking a mega auction likely to reshuffle squads. The Indian Premier League (IPL) auction will follow in mid-December. The WPL's fourth season is set to commence in January 2026, advanced to conclude before the Men's T20 World Cup.

title: Hold your breath! Annual punishment begins as Delhi sees toxic PM2.5 levels
content: Delhi experienced its worst PM2.5 pollution levels of the year following Diwali, with concentrations soaring to dangerous heights. Analysis revealed alarming figures, with some areas exceeding national and WHO guidelines significantly. Even days later, pollution remained exceptionally high, posing serious health risks as fine particles penetrate the bloodstream.

title: Canada‚Äôs ‚ÄòMaple Dream‚Äô wanes: Student intake falls; India feels the pinch
content: Canada‚Äôs international education sector faces an unprecedented slowdown, with new student arrivals dropping nearly 60% in 2025 compared to last year. Tighter permit caps, stricter financial and work regulations, and revised post-study pathways have deliberately shrunk the pipeline. The decline hits classrooms, campuses, and local economies, with Indian students‚ÄîCanada‚Äôs largest overseas cohort‚Äîbearing the brunt of these structural changes.

title: New bank rules: Opt for up to 4 nominees from November 1; top points to know
content: Good news for bank customers! From November 1, 2025, you can nominate up to four individuals for your accounts, either simultaneously or in succession. This move by the Finance Ministry aims to streamline claim settlements across banks, offering greater flexibility and clarity for depositors and their chosen beneficiaries. Specific share allocations can also be designated.

title: Tragic! Pak cricketer's newborn baby dies; shares heartbreaking post
content: Pakistan all-rounder Aamir Jamal has announced the tragic passing of his newborn child. The cricketer shared a heartfelt message on social media, accompanied by a photo of his baby's hand. The cricket fraternity and fans have extended their deepest condolences and offered support to Jamal and his family during this incredibly difficult time.

title: Denied Rs 20, ‚Äòdrunk‚Äô teen slits classmate‚Äôs throat, injures self; both survive
content: A shocking incident unfolded at a tribal sports school in Andhra Pradesh where a 14-year-old student, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, slit a classmate's throat over a Rs 20 demand. The attacker then attempted self-harm out of fear. The injured student is recovering, and the accused faces de-addiction treatment.

title: Bhopal tragedy: Farmer dies at doctor's doorstep waiting for treatment
content: A 55-year-old farmer died outside a doctor's residence in Panna after allegedly being denied treatment. Villagers protested, accusing the block medical officer of intoxication and negligence. The doctor was removed from his post, and an FIR was registered following the incident.

title: Chennai horror: Debt-ridden bizman kills wife, sons, then himself
content: A Chennai businessman, burdened by heavy debts and business losses, tragically killed his wife and two sons before taking his own life. Police suspect sedatives were administered before the murders, with no signs of struggle. A suicide note cited inability to repay loans as the reason for the extreme act.

title: Bad air: Punjab official goes to put out farm fire, gheraoed for 2 hours in Mansa
content: Farmers in Mansa, Punjab, surrounded a Punjab Pollution Control Board official. The incident occurred after the official arrived to douse a farm fire. Farmers demanded more balers to manage crop residue. The official was held for nearly two hours before police intervened and secured his release. This marks the first such backlash against government officials this year.

title: Teenager killed after being hit by train while shooting video near railway tracks in Puri
content: A purported video of the incident, recorded on the mobile phone of his friend, has surfaced on social media, police added

title: Over 60 land in Bhopal hospitals due to use of ‚Äòdangerous‚Äô carbide guns on Deepavali
content: Over 60 people, mostly children, were hospitalised in Bhopal after injuries from calcium carbide guns during Deepavali celebrations; health officials condemn their use and call for stricter sales enforcement

title: Quarter-century-old Kudumbashree hotel in Kochi staring at potential shutdown
content: City Corporation issues notice demanding that rent dues of ‚Çπ1.38 lakh be cleared. New Akshaya hotel at Ponnurunni was designated a Janakeeya Hotel under State government‚Äôs Hunger-Free Kerala project, under which the facility is eligible for rent waiver

title: The curtain falls on Hasanamba festival; over 26 lakh visit in 14 days
content: More than 26.13 lakh people visited the temple this year during the festival that began on October 9. The temple administration earned a revenue of ‚Çπ21.82 crore by way of selling tickets.

title: Congress MP Shafi Parambil alleges he was attacked in Perambra by ‚Äòtainted‚Äô police officer
content: Exhibiting videos of the incident, Vadakara MP claims the police official‚Äôs action against him seemed deliberate as he was attacked at least thrice with lathi

title: Argentina football friendly: Traders at Kaloor stadium in Kerala get partial reprieve as shutdown cut to three weeks
content: Over 100 tenants at Kochi stadium were initially ordered to close for a month starting October 25. However, after a meeting with GCDA chairperson, closure has been postponed to October 30, with a possible reopening on November 20

title: Column | Manjari Chaturvedi: didi¬†to all qawwals
content: The dancer pioneered Sufi Kathak to draw attention to¬†Qawwali¬†and began a project to preserve the folk art form

title: T.N. CM Stalin to inaugurate Solar bus terminal in Erode on November 27
content: The ‚Çπ74.90-crore facility, spread over¬†19.9 acres, is nearing completion, with painting, tile-laying, and electrical works progressing at a brisk pace

title: Decoy operation foils illegal sex determination in Mysuru district
content: The operation has exposed a serious violation of the Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act and the Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act, said an official

title: WazirX to restart on October 24, along with crypto trading and withdrawals
content: WazirX founder Nischal Shetty said that crypto trading and withdrawals will both start from October 24

title: Deceased ex-Governor Malik‚Äôs obituary reference, AAP MLA‚Äôs detention dominate first day of J&K Assembly
content: J&K Assembly session began with a tribute to former Governor Satya Pal Malik and detention of Aam Aadmi Party MLA Mehraj Malik under the Public Safety Act

title: Watch: Four wanted Bihar gangsters killed in police encounter in Delhi
content: A major overnight operation in Rohini, Delhi, ended with four wanted Bihar gangsters shot dead by a joint team of Delhi and Bihar Police. The slain criminals-Ranjan Pathak, Vimlesh Mahto, Manish Pathak, and Aman Thakur, were wanted for multiple serious crimes. Police say the accused opened fire first, leading to retaliatory firing. Investigations continue into the gang‚Äôs network and financial links.

title: Education, economic progress will reduce caste and religious divisions, says VIT Chancellor
content: MDMK leader Vaiko also spoke at the annual memorial lecture in honour of Dravidian stalwarts ‚ÄòPeriyar‚Äô E.V. Ramasamy and former Chief Minister C.N. Annadurai

title: Telangana bureaucrats caught between the devil and the deep blue sea, says KTR
content: BRS working president K.T. Rama Rao says senior bureaucrat S.A.M. Rizvi opting for VRS indicates the crossfire in which All India Service officers are caught in Telangana

title: Dhinakaran demands crop loss assessment in Cauvery delta
content: In a post on social media, Mr. Dhinakaran said the latest spell of heavy rainfall had damaged not only paddy but also other foodgrains, such as pulses and millets

title: Bihar election 2025: Full list of BJP candidates and their constituencies
content: BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: ‚ÄòBachke rehna re baba‚Äô: Congress claims PM not going for ASEAN summit to avoid meeting Trump
content: Jairam Ramesh alleges Prime Minister opted for virtual participation to avoid ‚Äúbeing cornered‚Äù by the U.S. President

title: Bihar Assembly elections 2025: When will Bihar vote? Key dates, phases, and counting schedule
content: The Election Commission of India has announced a two-phase schedule for the Bihar Assembly elections 2025, with 121 constituencies voting on November 6 and 122 on November 11, followed by counting on November 14.

title: Super GST-Super Savings catches attention of everyone with special awareness programmes: Vizianagaram Collector
content: Speaking to media, he said the Union and State Governments‚Äô initiative on reduction of tax slabs had benefited people with the significant drop in prices of all essential goods, consumer products, two wheelers, cars and other products

title: Botanists from Davangere discover three new plant species; another reported for the first time in Karnataka
content: Botanists estimate existence of around 30,00,000 plant species across the globe and so far 2,50,000 species are known while 27,50,000 species are to yet be discovered

title: Bihar Assembly elections 2025: JD(U) releases full list of 101 candidates
content: The Janata Dal (United) has released the complete list of 101 candidates for the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections

title: Three arrested within 12 hours of firing on cow protection group member in Hyderabad
content: The shooting stemmed from a dispute after accused Mohammad Ibrahim Qureshi suffered losses of about ‚Çπ1 crore when victim allegedly intercepted his cattle transport vehicles

title: Senthamangalam DMK MLA K. Ponnusamy passes away
content: On October 23, he complained of chest pain and was first rushed to the Kolli Hills Government Hospital

title: RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi Yadav to be CM face of INDIA bloc in Bihar
content: VIP chief Mukesh Sahani declared as Deputy CM face; one more Deputy CM name to be announced later; Gehlot asks BJP leadership to name its Chief Minister candidate

title: Case registered against traders‚Äô body leaders for conducting illegal lottery draw in Kerala
content: As per FIR, the accused allegedly conducted a lottery draw on October 2 with the intention to cheat Kerala government. They printed and sold coupons to public carrying logo resembling Onam Bumper lottery

title: Massive fire breaks out at business centre in Mumbai
content: According to officials, the incident was first reported at 10:51 a.m., and within a few minutes, it escalated from Level-I to Level-III

title: CM Chandrababu Naidu invites UAE investors to explore Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs growth potential
content: CM Naidu wants industrialists to bring right proposals so that government can ensure prompt clearances for setting up industries

title: Watch: Ladakh statehood talks resume: What is MHA offering?
content: Talks between Ladakh‚Äôs civil society groups and the Union Home Ministry resumed in New Delhi after last month‚Äôs deadly protests demanding Statehood. Officials hinted at possible safeguards under Article 371, but the Leh Apex Body and Kargil Democratic Alliance reiterated their demand for inclusion under the Sixth Schedule. The groups also sought the release of activist Sonam Wangchuk. With tensions high since Ladakh lost its special status in 2019, the region awaits clarity on its political future and autonomy.

title: WB Police arrest one for ‚Äòidol desecration‚Äô in Kakdwip, cite ‚Äòprotection of idol‚Äô as reason for shifting in prison van
content: West Bengal BJP took to social media to condemn the placing of idol in prison van as protests erupted in the region following the alleged vandalism

title: Govt sets November 14 deadline for public feedback on draft rules for National Sports Governance Act
content: India‚Äôs Sports Ministry has set November 14 as the deadline for public feedback on the National Sports Governance Act draft, aimed at reforming sports administration and ensuring athlete protection

title: Chennai reels under bad roads this Northeast monsoon: a compilation
content: Here is a collection of reports published by The Hindu on Chennai city‚Äôs deteriorating road conditions

title: Piyush Goyal to discuss ways to boost trade, investments with leaders, businesses of Germany
content: During the visit on October 23, Mr. Goyal will hold bilateral meetings with German Federal Minister for Economic Affairs and Energy Katherina Reiche, and Economic and Financial Policy Advisor at the Federal Chancellery and Germany‚Äôs G7 and G20 Sherpa Levin Holle

title: Kerala DySP‚Äôs WhatsApp post on President‚Äôs Sabarimala visit sparks controversy
content: In his WhatsApp status message, Alathur DySP claimed that President flagrantly violated Sabarimala customs and that security personnel in uniform had abetted this breach of tradition. After the post sparked a controversy, he deleted it

title: Centre releases ‚Çπ665 cr. to Andhra Pradesh under MGNREGS
content: Deputy Chief Minister K. Pawan Kalyan expressed his gratitude to the Central Government for the fund sanction and release

title: IED blast on railway track disrupts train services in Assam
content: The explosion took place around five kilometres from Kokrajhar railway station on the route towards Salakati after midnight, an official said.

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT detains TDB official Murari Babu for questioning
content: SIT had earlier arraigned Murari Babu as an accused based on TDB‚Äôs Vigilance report. According to officials, a plainclothes team detained him at his house at Perunna, Kottayam, late Wednesday night

title: Gang planning to spread terror during Bihar polls gunned down in Delhi
content: In a 10-minute shootout, 20 police officers kill four men wanted in extortion and murder cases in Bihar, recover audio clip in which gang leader could be heard conspiring to disrupt Bihar election through violence

title: Indian-origin historian Sunil Amrith wins British Academy Book Prize
content: Amrith, a Professor of History at Yale University in the U.S., was born in Kenya to South Indian parents, grew up in Singapore and graduated from the University of Cambridge in England.

title: Delhi-NCR air quality remains ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô, overall AQI at 362
content: According to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) in the national capital stood at 362 as of 6 a.m. on Thursday (October 23, 2025)

title: Six held as student dies after assault during freshers‚Äô party at Latur college
content: A minor dispute that began while dancing during the bash soon escalated into violence when the victim, Suraj Shinde, had an argument with a group of fellow students.

title: Bihar Assembly election updates: Amit Shah made clear BJP will not let Nitish Kumar hold top post, claims INDIA bloc CM face Tejashwi Yadav
content: PM Modi trains guns on Mahagathbandhan, says "people won't forget 'jungle raj' for another 100 years"

title: PM Modi to attend ASEAN summit virtually; Jaishankar to lead delegation in Malaysia
content: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim says Modi cited Deepavali as the reason for change in travel plan; Leaders, including Trump, are scheduled to attend East Asia Summit in Kuala Lumpur

title: Nearly 35% of Chennai Metro Rail‚Äôs tunnelling completed in city for phase II project
content: Officials said, the underground construction is gradually picking up pace and this month alone, three tunnels‚Äîbetween Greenways Road and Mandaveli, Royapettah and Dr. Radhakrishnan Salai and Panagal Park to Kodambakkam‚Äîfinished their journeys.

title: Depositors of MHPFNL want State government to intervene and recover money
content: The association called for rapid recovery of assets and properties acquired using the depositors‚Äô money and full repayment of the principal along with accumulated interest.¬†

title: Indian astro community‚Äôs vision for solar physics, space weather
content: ‚ÄòThe key scientific question is understanding solar eruptions, such as solar flares and coronal mass ejections, and their potential impact on space assets like satellites orbiting earth,‚Äô Vaibhav Pant, scientist at the Aryabhata Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES), said

title: Tamil Nadu government to confer Vaikom Award for Social Justice to activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will present the award which carries a cash prize of ‚Çπ5 lakh, a citation and a medal.

title: IndiGo plane enroute to Srinagar lands in Varanasi after fuel leak alert; all 166 passengers safe
content: All 166 passengers on board were reported to be safe and were escorted to the arrival hall soon after landing, they said

title: Mega investment project for electric vehicle manufacturing coming up in Rajasthan
content: The plant, to be established at 65.56 acres of land, will play a crucial role in supplying affordable e-buses all over the country and promote the renewable energy sector

title: TMC says Union Govt not releasing funds to West Bengal amounts to deliberate financial strangulation
content: The West Bengal‚Äôs ruling party said that while funds have been made available to Maharashtra and Karnataka to douse their flood crisis, yet left food ravaged West Bengal has been left out in the cold.

title: Former RJD leader, convicted by CBI court, joins BJP
content: Sahani was inducted into the saffron party in the presence of Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, the party's in-charge for Assembly polls, and national general secretary Vinod Tawde.

title: Eyeing investment push, U.P. Government to open satellite investment promotion offices in five metro cities
content: U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has already approved the proposal for restructuring ‚ÄòInvest U.P.‚Äô

title: EC cancels nomination of RJD leader Shweta Suman
content: Suman‚Äôs nomination was rejected after the Commission found that she was a resident of Uttar Pradesh, making her ineligible to contest the election.

title: Protests erupt in West Bengal‚Äôs Kakdwip over ‚Äòdesecrated idol‚Äô
content: Leaders of the West Bengal BJP made serious allegations about the desecration of the idol, demanding immediate arrests and a probe into ‚Äúadministrative negligence.‚Äù

title: Fadnavis warns of strict action after namaz video sparks Shaniwar Wada row in Pune
content: Three women are booked under AMASR Rules for offering namaz inside Pune‚Äôs historic fort, Shaniwar Wada. ¬†

title: Mohan Majhi govt. hands over recruitment scam probe to CBI
content: Since roots of the scam may extend beyond Odisha to Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, and other States, CBI is the right agency to probe the scam, says Odisha govt.

title: As talks on Ladakh resume, Centre offers special provisions under Article 371
content: Home Ministry makes proposal in fresh talks with Leh, Kargil civil society groups, who continue to demand Sixth Schedule status, Statehood; groups also demand release of Sonam Wangchuk, other detained protesters

title: Uproar over elder from SC community forced to lick ground as Opposition alleges display of casteism
content: 60-year-old man from the Scheduled Caste community was forced to lick the ground near Sheetla Maataa Mandir in Kakori area on the outskirts of the State capital on Deepavali after accidentally urinating near the temple; Congress and AAP call for justice for victim

title: Ahead of pan-India SIR, Election Commission tracks voter mapping progress
content: The exercise involves standardising addresses and correcting discrepancies through house-to-house visits by booth-level officers

title: Tejashwi, Tej Pratap are poles apart in tough battle for neighbouring seats
content: One brother has the family‚Äôs support and the other is on his own; their father Lalu Prasad‚Äôs name stands Tejashwi in good stead in Raghopur, but Tej Pratap, candidate of his own party after being disowned by parents and ousted from the RJD, faces a mounting challenge in Mahua constituency

title: Political row erupts in U.P. over Adityanath‚Äôs ‚Äòhalal certification‚Äô remarks
content: Opposition accuses Chief Minister of attempting to polarise voters, divert focus from jobs and economy

title: ‚ÄòLight a lamp‚Äô campaign held in Bengaluru for fair investigation into Dharmasthala case
content: The organisers will also start a letter-writing campaign in November to further spread awareness on the demands of the campaign

title: Internal rift in grand alliance in Bihar, says BJP
content: BJP national spokesperson claims a rift in Bihar‚Äôs grand alliance hinders candidate selection, while highlighting NDA‚Äôs women empowerment initiatives

title: Show cause notices issued to nearly 1,000 West Bengal BLOs unwilling to participate in electoral process
content: BLOs refusing to participate in the electoral process have cited security reasons; they have been directed to reply within 72 hours of receiving the notice from the Chief Electoral Officer

title: Another man held in West Bengal doctor assault case
content: Total arrests rise to three; political parties continue protests over women‚Äôs safety and attacks on medical professionals in West Bengal

title: Frequent disruption of LPG cylinder supply worries households
content: In the latest incident, cylinder movement to six districts was affected as the drivers stayed away from work following a strike at BPCL LPG bottling plant at Ambalamedu

title: Assam government to introduce bills on 'love jihad,' polygamy: Himanta
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said details will be shared once the draft bills are approved by the state cabinet

title: Ruling National Conference grapples with an upset Congress, piqued MP Ruhullah ahead of Assembly, Rajya Sabha bypolls
content: Congress skips the meeting for coalition partners chaired by NC chief Farooq Abdullah and CM Omar Abdullah; ruling party battles with MP Ruhullah‚Äôs decision to keep away from campaigns

title: NHAI to deploy 3D sensors to identify potholes, road cracks across 23 States
content: Data shall be collected for all projects involving two- to eight-lane highways by deploying vehicles equipped with advanced sensors and data acquisition systems

title: Courts Moral Conscience Of Constitution, Protects Democracy: Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai said that courts play a far greater role than simply adjudicating disputes, describing the judiciary as a "moral conscience of the Constitution" responsible for safeguarding democracy

title: Op Sindoor Showed Navy's Power, Forced Pak To Stay In Harbour: Rajnath Singh
content: The world witnessed the Indian Navy's strength during Operation Sindoor as its deterrent posture forced Pakistan to remain in the harbour or near its coast, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Thursday, hailing the force's combat readiness.

title: Judiciary Must Evolve: Supreme Court Judge Surya Kant On New Challenges
content: Supreme Court judge Surya Kant said the judiciary needs to evolve and innovate to deal with new challenges like digital exclusion, displacement, climate vulnerability and transnational migration, or it will face the risk of becoming its own shadow

title: Putin Brushes Off Trumps Oil Sanctions, Issues A Tomahawk Warning
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday the latest US sanctions targeting two major oil firms were "serious", but not strong enough to significantly affect the economy.

title: Delhi Engineer Disabled In Road Accident Awarded Rs 70 Lakh Compensation
content: A motor accident claims tribunal has awarded compensation of more than Rs 70.60 lakh to a 30-year-old software engineer who was injured in a road accident in 2015.

title: For Ladli Behnas Of Madhya Pradesh, Rs 250 Festive Bonus Delayed
content: The much-awaited Bhai Dooj gift for millions of Ladli Behnas in Madhya Pradesh failed to arrive on Thursday. The Rs 250 festival installment promised by the government under the Ladli Behna Yojana was not transferred.

title: For Ladli Behnas Of Madhya Pradesh, Rs 250 Festive Bonus Delayed
content: The much-awaited Bhai Dooj gift for millions of Ladli Behnas in Madhya Pradesh failed to arrive on Thursday. The Rs 250 festival installment promised by the government under the Ladli Behna Yojana was not transferred.

title: Indian Student, 18, Dies Of Cardiac Arrest During Diwali In Dubai
content: An 18-year-old Indian student, recipient of the UAE Golden Visa, died of cardiac arrest in Dubai during Diwali celebrations, local media reported.

title: Rising Heat Waves Are Putting Pregnant Women At Growing Risk. Here's How
content: Doctors have long known that heat puts a strain on the heart, kidneys and other organs. Those risks are exacerbated for pregnant people, as the body's processes for staying cool are altered.

title: Tomato Prices Soar 400% In Pakistan As Afghanistan Border Shutdown Bites
content: Border closures between Pakistan and Afghanistan have pushed up prices of essential goods in both nations, with tomatoes now costing five times more in Pakistan since fighting broke out between the two South Asian neighbours this month.

title: Punjab Kingpin Who Retrieved Drugs Dropped By Cross-Border Drones Arrested
content: In a major breakthrough against cross-border drug smuggling, the Punjab Police have busted a narcotics trafficking module operating along the India-Pakistan border.

title: 3 Arrested For Theft From Cars Parked Near Bharat Mandapam, Supreme Court
content: The Delhi Police has arrested three members of the 'Thak-Thak' gang who allegedly stole laptops and valuables from parked cars across the city including near Bharat Mandapam and the Supreme Court, an official said on Thursday.

title: Elderly Woman Beaten In Kolkata For Objecting To Late-Night Firecrackers
content: An elderly woman on Thursday lodged a complaint against five men for beating her up after she objected to bursting firecrackers late at night. The incident took place in Bhawanipur area in south Kolkata in the early hours of Tuesday.

title: Festive Season Chokes Mumbai As October Becomes Most Polluted Month In 2025
content: Pollution level in Mumbai has spiked sharply, making October the most polluted month of the year so far, according to an analysis done by an independent research organisation.

title: France Issues Third Warrant Against Ousted Syrian Leader Bashar al-Assad
content: French magistrates this summer issued a new arrest warrant against ousted Syrian president Bashar al-Assad over deadly chemical attacks in 2013, a judicial source said on Thursday.

title: Andhra Mine To Louvre: Bloody History Of $60 Million Diamond Spared In Heist
content: Thieves entered Paris' Louvre earlier this week and left within minutes with priceless Napoleonic jewels, leaving behind a $60 million diamond that is the largest of its kind in Europe and was found in India hundreds of years ago.

title: Rajasthan Government Schools Shine After Diwali Beautification. See Pics
content: The Rajasthan government has made a landmark initiative under the school beautification and transformation campaign, officials said. The state government led by Bhajanlal Sharma has created a new chapter in its education history.

title: Israeli Minister Walks Back Remarks Telling Saudis To "Keep Riding Camels"
content: Israel's far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich on Thursday expressed regret for what he called his "unfortunate" remarks about Saudi Arabia.

title: Trump Warns Israel Could Lose "All" US Support If It Annexes West Bank
content: President Donald Trump said Israel would lose its crucial backing from the United States if it annexes the occupied West Bank, in an interview published Thursday.

title: Ranking every open Power 4 job in college football
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . no coach is safe, but a strong line of storms has been forecasted . a total of 298-150 coaches have been fired from the power conference .

title: Sikh trucker crashes American dreams of many immigrants from Punjab
content: crash site the TOI correspondent from Washington: The American dream for thousands of Sikh immigrants from India is hanging in the balance following a second fatal trucking accident involving a driver with a controversial immigration history . the driver, Jashanpreet Singh, is reportedly an Indian illegal immigrant who was released from border custody by the Biden administration in 2022 .

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Is anyone taking Ciryl Gane to upset Tom Aspinall?
content: aspinall will make his anticipated return to the Octagon against former interim champion Ciryl Gane on saturday . he owns the UFC record for shortest average fight time at 2 minutes, 2 seconds . the heavyweight is taking on the fourth-mostaccurate heavyweight in UFC history .

title: Coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire join the WNBA next year . the franchise will have an international coach to launch the team . Brondello is a native of australia who has two decades of coaching experience in the league . she has been a head coach for 13 seasons and an assistant for eight seasons .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: What if Ohtani WAS on that plane to Toronto? Inside an alternate World Series universe
content: Shohei Ohtani and Vladimir Guerrero will be at the plate for the 2025 world series . there is another world, one not as far-fetched as you might think . Roki Sasaki could be playing the part of rookie sensation for the Blue Jays .

title: VUL's Newman keeps drawing complaints and controversy
content: a former coach is accused of using false promises to lure athletes and coaches to a historically black private university in Virginia . he has worked as a football coach and athletic director since 2021 . some of the lawsuit allegations are denied by the university's attorney in a court filing .

title: Ranking ringless NBA teams by chances to win their first title by 2031
content: the 2014 season was the only seven-year stretch in league history that featured seven unique champions . only two of those seven were true first-time winners . the 2025 Oklahoma City Thunder are technically multitime champions, but the pattern still underscores how much the NBA has been stingy about letting new teams into its championship club.

title: Buzz for Week 8: The latest on the trade deadline, QB futures, more
content: the "Get Up" crew weighs in on the state of the Dolphins . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they asked around about two struggling AFC East teams, the 0-7 Jets and the 1-6 .

title: Who will win Dodgers-Blue Jays World Series? MLB scouts, execs and managers make their predictions
content: the Toronto Blue Jays host the los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 on friday . the 2025 world series is nearly upon us . what should you expect from the team's pitching staff? which X factors will determine this October's last team standing?
